title: Complementary feeding: a survey on the Healthcare Professional practices

introduction.description: The introduction of solid foods and drinks other than milk (complementary feeding) is a key developmental milestone that exerts powerful changes in terms of functional changes to the gastrointestinal tract, the immune system and metabolic processes. Moreover, the timing of food introduction appears crucial for the prevention of food allergy. The aim of the current survey is to collect information on the usual practices of healthcare professionals from different countries about the order of solid foods' introduction into the infants diet and the how this differs for infants at low or high risk for development of food allergy.
introduction.duration: Completion of the questionnaire will take approximately 10 minutes.
introduction.passwordPrompt: If you agree to participate in this research, please type the password that was provided to you:

survey.thanks: Thank you for your participation in this research study.
survey.guidance: Please answer all questions as accurately as possible. Your responses will remain confidential.
survey.title: Complementary feeding: a survey on the Healthcare Professional practices

q7.title: At what age do you advise the introduction of complementary food for an infant
q7.increased_risk: At increased risk to develop food allergy:

q8.title: When do you consider an infant at 'increased risk to develop food allergy'? (multiple choices possible)

choices.family_history: Direct family history (i.e. parents, siblings) of any allergy, atopic dermatitis, asthma or rhinoconjuctivitis

q9a.title: Do you apply further measures in order to prevent food allergy in infants and young children at low risk for food allergy?

elaborate.title: Please elaborate on the measures applied:

choices.soy_formula: Introducing soy protein-based formula in the first 6 mo of life to prevent cow's milk allergy
choices.restrict_allergens: Restricting consumption of potential food allergens during pregnancy or breastfeeding
choices.prebiotics: Prebiotics, probiotics or synbiotics for pregnant and/or breastfeeding women and/ or infants
choices.vitamin_supplements: Vitamin supplementation or fish oil supplementation during pregnancy and/or breastfeeding women and/or infants
choices.regular_formula: Regular cow's milk–based infant formula after the first week of life to prevent food allergy

q9b.title: Do you apply further measures in order to prevent food allergy in infants and young children at high risk for food allergy?

elaborate.title: Please elaborate on the measures applied:

choices.soy_formula: Introducing soy protein-based formula in the first 6 mo of life to prevent cow's milk allergy
choices.restrict_allergens: Restricting consumption of potential food allergens during pregnancy or breastfeeding
choices.prebiotics: Prebiotics, probiotics or synbiotics for pregnant and/or breastfeeding women and/ or infants
choices.vitamin_supplements: Vitamin supplementation or fish oil supplementation during pregnancy and/or breastfeeding women and/or infants
choices.regular_formula: Regular cow's milk–based infant formula after the first week of life to prevent food allergy

food_items.title: Food Items to Introduce
food_items.description: Select one or more items from the list. Items will appear based on the selected food category.

starch.gluten_grains: Gluten containing grains (wheat, barley, rye eg pasta, bread, etc)
starch.maize_products: Maize products (i.e. pollenta, baby maize snacks)

vegetables.zucchini: Zucchini or courgette οr other squashes

fish.mollusks: Mollusks (clams, scallops, oysters, mussels, octopus, snails, kalamari, cuttlefish)

fruit.apple: Apple (and products made from apple like apple sauce)

egg.partially_cooked: Partially cooked like scrambled egg and sunny side egg

additional.baby_food: Preprepared baby food - Baby jars, pouches
additional.finger_food: Food in pieces and finger food
